description.narrative: The Pacific Partnership II with the International Finance Corporation (IFC) will contribute to sustainable economic growth and private sector development in the Pacific region. The Partnership will: mobilise new private sector investment through IFC interventions; source additional direct investment or co-investment in the Pacific private sector; generate private sector cost savings through interventions to reduce the cost of doing trade and to improve trade logistics; improve men and women’s access to financial services; strengthen and promote women’s economic empowerment; and increase access to infrastructure. The investment builds on the success of Phase 1 of the Australia-New Zealand-IFC Pacific Partnership which has helped to build a stronger environment for the private sector across the Pacific; created sustainable jobs; facilitated new foreign direct investment into the Pacific; strengthened supply chains; increased access to finance; facilitated private sector involvement in l
